Clean up the data (do not show the code).

```{r, echo=FALSE}
D4 <- readSheet("Bleeding")
D4 <- tidyData(D4)
show(D4)
network <- mtc.network(D4[!is.na(responders)])
```

# Network plot

```{r bleedingNetwork}
plot(network)
```

Run the model using `r sprintf("%s-effects", effect)`.

```{r, results='hide'}
M <- mtc.model(network, type="consistency", linearModel=effect)
runtime <- system.time(results <- mtc.run(M, n.adapt=nAdapt, n.iter=nIter, thin=thin))
```

# Summary

Head-to-head odds ratios and 95% confidence bounds are stored in
[mtcBleedingHTH.csv](mtcBleedingHTH.csv).

```{r}
hth <- combineResults()
hth[, .(label, result)]
write.csv(hth, file="mtcBleedingHTH.csv", row.names=FALSE)
```

# Diagnostics

```{r}
runtime
summary(results)
```

Sampler diagnostics.

```{r bleedingGelman, fig.height=8}
gelman.plot(results)
gelman.diag(results)
```

```{r bleedingTrace, fig.height=10}
plot(results)
```

Assess the degree of heterogeneity and inconsistency.

```{r, results='hide'}
anohe <- mtc.anohe(network, n.adapt=nAdapt, n.iter=nIter, thin=thin)
```

```{r bleedingAnohe, fig.height=8}
summary(anohe)
plot(anohe)
```
